comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:JORDAN, HAROLD
Initials:H
Nationality:United Kingdom
Rank:Petty Officer Stoker
Regiment/Service:Royal Navy
Unit Text:H.M.S. "Strongbow."
Age:30
Date of Death:17/10/1917
Service No:309611
Additional information:Son of Alfred and Fanny Jordan, of 101, Laurel Rd., Leicester.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:23.
Memorial:CHATHAM NAVAL MEMORIAL

comment.author: 45705454@N06
comment._content: For more information about the sinking of HMS Strongbow on OCTOBER 17 1917, visit: www.hmsstrongbow.org.uk

comment.author: 16830149@N02
comment._content:
From UK Royal Navy & Royal Marine War Graves Roll
Name: Harold Jordan 
Rank: Sto PO 
Birth Date: 8 May 1887 
Birth Place: Aylestone, Leicester, England 
Branch of Service: Royal Navy 
Cause of Death: Killed or died as a direct result of enemy action 
Official Number Port Division: 309611. (Ch) 
Death Date: 17 Oct 1917 
Ship or Unit: HMS Strongbow 
Location of Grave: Not recorded 
Name and Address of Cemetery: Body Not Recovered For Burial 
Relatives Notified and Address: Mother: Fanny 101, Laurel Rd, Highfields, Leicester

comment.author: 44476552@N05
comment._content: On the 1911 census he was a Stoker aboard HMS Bruizer.
